name: Git Auto Commit
description: Automatically commits changes after file edits with descriptive messages

hooks.command: FILE=$(echo '$TOOL_INPUT' | jq -r '.file_path // empty'); if [ -n "$FILE" ] && [ -f "$FILE" ]; then git add "$FILE" 2>/dev/null && git commit -m "Auto-commit: Updated $FILE via Claude Code" 2>/dev/null || true; fi

FILE=$(echo '$TOOL_INPUT' | jq -r '.file_path // empty'); if [ -n "$FILE" ] && [ -f "$FILE" ]; then git add "$FILE" 2>/dev/null && git commit -m "Auto-commit: Created $FILE via Claude Code" 2>/dev/null || true; fi

setup_instructions: This hook automatically commits file changes to git. Make sure you're in a git repository. The hook will silently fail if git is not available or file is not in a git repo.
